Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.tugraz.ist.soma.algorithms.Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents one node of the PDG.
    Author:
    Stephan Fr√ºhwirt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Node()
      use this constructor if you want to create the ENTRY node.
      Node(Statement statement)
      use this constructor if you want to create a new node.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendControlDependency(Node node)
      appends a control dependency to this node, i.e. a link between this node and a given node.
      void appendDataDependency(Node node)
      appends a data dependency to this node, i.e. a link between this node and a given node.
      java.util.ArrayList<Node> getAllDependencies()
      returns an array list of all dependencies (control + data).
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Node> getControlDependencies()
      returns the control dependencies of this node.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Node> getDataDependencies()
      returns the data dependencies of this node.
      Statement getStatement()
      returns the Statement of a node.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node()
        use this constructor if you want to create the ENTRY node. You can recognize the ENTRY node via the statement variable which should always be null.

      • Node

        public Node(Statement statement)
        use this constructor if you want to create a new node. If you want to create the ENTRY node you should use the Node() constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • appendControlDependency

        public void appendControlDependency(Node node)
        appends a control dependency to this node, i.e. a link between this node and a given node.
        HINT: think about in which direction you should save the linkages!

      • getControlDependencies

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Node> getControlDependencies()
        returns the control dependencies of this node.

      • appendDataDependency

        public void appendDataDependency(Node node)
        appends a data dependency to this node, i.e. a link between this node and a given node.
        HINT: think about in which direction you should save the linkages!

      • getDataDependencies

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Node> getDataDependencies()
        returns the data dependencies of this node.

      • getAllDependencies

        public java.util.ArrayList<Node> getAllDependencies()
        returns an array list of all dependencies (control + data). Might be useful when you calculate the slice.

      • getStatement

        public Statement getStatement()
        returns the Statement of a node.
